TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant was charged with disorderly conduct . On DATE he signed an undertaking not to leave the town .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Justice of the Peace of LOC of GPE found the applicant guilty as charged and sentenced him to DATE and DATE imprisonment , conditionally suspended for DATE . It ordered the applicant to remain in the town until the conviction became final . The applicant and the prosecutor appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE upheld the applicant 's conviction on appeal . It revoked the suspension of the sentence , however . On DATE the applicant was taken into custody .

CARDINAL . Further to a cassation appeal lodged by the applicant , on DATE ORG of GPE quashed ORG judgment of DATE and remitted the case to ORG for fresh examination . ORG noted that ORG had failed to observe the procedure pertaining to the presentation of the final submissions by the parties and to classify the conviction in full compliance with the applicable substantive law .

CARDINAL . The applicant remained in custody . He allegedly complained to the director of the remand prison that his continued detention was not based on a judicial decision and asked to be released . The director responded by informing him that a certain “ Judge PERSON had told him not to release the applicant until further notice . The applicant also complained to ORG but received no reply .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG fixed an appeal hearing for DATE . Neither the applicant nor his counsel attended the hearing . As regards the applicant 's detention , the court noted as follows :
“ The preventive measure , notably placement of [ the applicant ] in custody , should remain unchanged . ”

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , he received a copy of the decision of CARDINAL DATE on DATE . Therefore , he considered that he had missed the DATE time - limit for challenging the decision in question and did not lodge an appeal against it .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the applicant 's conviction on appeal and revoked the suspension of his conditional sentence . The applicant was represented by PERSON , state - appointed counsel . Both the applicant and the prosecutor appealed .

CARDINAL . ORG scheduled a hearing for DATE . On CARDINAL DATE the court dispatched summonses to the parties , including the applicant and his counsel , notifying them of the date and time of the hearing .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held the cassation hearing . It heard the prosecutor and granted his request to reclassify the charges against the applicant . CARDINAL . A defendant can be remanded in custody or his detention can be extended only on the basis of a judicial decision ( NORP LAW , Article CARDINAL ) . The court should make the relevant decision upon a reasoned request by the prosecutor or the investigator supported by appropriate evidence ( Code of Criminal Procedure , Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) or of its own motion ( Code of Criminal Procedure , LAW ) .

CARDINAL . When considering a cassation appeal lodged by CARDINAL of the parties to the criminal proceedings , the cassation court is required to decide whether or not a preventive measure , including placement in custody , should be applied pending a new hearing ( Code of Criminal Procedure , Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . ORG of GPE provided the following interpretation of the relevant parts of LAW no . CARDINAL “ on application of the rules set forth in LAW governing appeal and cassation proceedings , adopted on DATE , as amended ) :

“ CARDINAL . When quashing the verdict or any other judicial act and remitting the matter for fresh consideration to the trial or appeal court or to the prosecutor , the cassation court should , if asked by the prosecutor or of its own motion , decide whether to apply a preventive measure in respect of the defendant who is held in custody , the aims [ of this decision ] being the protection of the rights and legal interests of the parties to the proceedings and the proper conduct of the court hearing within a reasonable time . The court may impose any of the preventive measures authorised by [ law ] provided it ensures that the said aims are achieved .

When deciding to extend the defendant 's detention ... , the cassation court should specify ... the exact time - limit of the [ detention ] . If , on the date of the decision , the earlier imposed detention period has not expired and this period is sufficient to secure the above - mentioned aims , [ the court ] should indicate ... that the previously imposed detention will remain unchanged . In any event , [ the court ] should state the reasons for its decision . ”

CARDINAL . The failure of a party , who has been duly notified of the date , time and place of the cassation hearing , to attend the hearing should not preclude the court from proceeding with the examination of the case ( Code of Criminal Procedure , Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . If a convicted person wishes to take part in the appeal hearing , he or she must indicate this request in his statement of appeal ( Code of Criminal Procedure , LAW ) .
CARDINAL . If the court is unable to proceed owing to the absence of a party summoned to court , it must adjourn the hearing ( Code of Criminal Procedure , Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) .
